desc1.pins1: XTAL1 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (input)

desc2.pins1: XTAL2 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (output)

desc6.pins2: INT0 - External Interrupt source 0 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc6.pins3: OC0B - Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter0 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC0B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc7.pins2: INT1 - External Interrupt source 1 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc7.pins3: AIN0 - AIN0, Analog Comparator Positive Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the positive input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.

desc8.pins2: INT2 - External Interrupt source 2 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc8.pins3: AIN1 - AIN1, Analog Comparator Negative Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the negative input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.
desc8.pins4: RXD1 - Receive Data (data input pin for the UART). When the UART receiver is enabled, this pin is configured as an input. When the UART forces this pin to be an input, a logical state on PORT register will turn on the internal pull-up. Channel 1

desc9.pins2: INT3 - External Interrupt source 3 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc9.pins3: TXD1 - Transmit Data (data output pin for the UART). When the UART transmitter is enabled, this pin is configured as an output. Channel 1

desc10.pins2: INT5 - External Interrupt source 5 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc12.pins2: INT6 - External Interrupt source 6 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc13.pins2: INT7 - External Interrupt source 7 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc13.pins3: T0 - Timer/Counter0 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.

desc14.pins3: /SS - Slave Select pin for using with SPI.

desc15.pins3: SCK - Clock input pin for memory up/downloading or SPI.

desc16.pins3: MOSI - Data input pin for memory downloading or SPI.
desc16.pins4: PDI - SPI Serial Programming Data input. During serial program downloading, this pin is used as data input line.

desc17.pins2: PDO - SPI Serial Programming Data output. During Serial Program Downloading, this pin is used as data output line.
desc17.pins3: MISO - Data output pin for memory uploading or SPI.

desc18.pins2: T1 - Timer/Counter1 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.

desc21.pins3: OC0A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter0 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC0A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.
desc21.pins4: OC1C - Output compare matchC output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1C pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc22.pins2: INT4 - External Interrupt source 4 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.
desc22.pins3: ICP1 - Timer/Counter1 Input Capture pin. See the Timer/Counter1 description for further details.

desc23.pins2: OC1A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc24.pins1: /RESET - Reset pin for MCU, active at low.
desc24.pins3: dW - debugWIRE On-chip debug system uses a One-wire, bi-directional interface to control the program flow, execute AVR instructions in the CPU and to program the different non-volatile memories.

desc25.pins3: OC1B - Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc27.pins1: UCAP - USB Pads Internal Regulator Output supply voltage. Should be connected to an external capacitor

desc29.pins1: D+/SCK - USB Full Speed Positive Data Upstream port / Clock port for PS/2

desc30.pins1: D-/SDATA - USB Full Speed Negative Data Upstream port / Data port for PS/2

desc31.pins1: UVCC - USB Pads Internal Regulator Input supply voltage

desc32.pins1: AVCC - Power supply for AD converter.
